entry.title: โWe are here to stay,โ pledge Jerusalemโs Armenians, as land conflict escalates

media:group.media:title: โWe are here to stay,โ pledge Jerusalemโs Armenians, as land conflict escalates
media:group.media:description:
On Wednesday, a group of Israeli police officers entered an area of the Armenian Quarter in Jerusalemโs Old City known as the Cowsโ Garden and began dismantling outposts set up there by members of the Armenian community.
This is far from the first incident pitting law enforcement and settler groups against Jerusalemโs Armenians, who for more than six months now, have organized round-the-clock sit-ins in an effort to save the Cowsโ Garden from a takeover by Israeli real estate developers.
Armenian community members say losing the Cowsโ Garden would pose an existential threat to their community and would irrevocably damage Jerusalemโs multicultural and multireligious character.
CivilNetโs Mark Dovich sits down with Setrag Balian, co-founder of the Save the ArQ movement, to review the latest developments in Jerusalem and discuss the steps the cityโs Armenians are taking to defend and preserve their homes.
0:00 What happened in this latest incident in Jerusalem? 7:12 How is the Cowsโ Garden controversy being litigated now? 15:36 How is the Gaza war impacting Jerusalemโs Armenians? 17:57 What is the situation on the ground in Jerusalem now?
Also watch: โWe are living in hell, 25% of our Armenian Quarter is goneโ - PART 1 https://youtu.be/l6nJbBqx8Bw โIn 20 years, you may not find Armenians, Catholics or Greeks in Jerusalemโ https://youtu.be/vfxWCw0OcwU

entry.title: EU, US announce major financial aid programs for Armenia, Karabakh Armenians

media:group.media:title: EU, US announce major financial aid programs for Armenia, Karabakh Armenians
media:group.media:description:
๐ The United States and European Union will collectively provide Armenia with additional financial support worth nearly $360 million to support the countryโs development and address the needs of Armenians forcibly displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh. ๐ Turkey accused Washington and Brussels of siding with Yerevan over Baku, claiming growing ties between Armenia and the West โwill pave the way for the South Caucasus to become an area of geopolitical confrontation.โ

ีีดีผีกีถ ีกีพีกึีฟีซึ ีฐีฅีฟีธ ิตึึีกีถีซ ึีธีฒีธึีถีฅึีธึีด ีฐีกีดีกีฟีกึีกีฎ ึีธีฝีฅึ ีฅีถ, ีธึีธีถึ ีกีถีฐีกึีดีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีฅีถ ีบีกีฟีณีกีผีธึีด ีพีกึีธึีคีถีฅึีซีถึ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีถ ีกีตึีฅีฌีฅึ ีีธึ ีีธึึ ีพีกึีนีกีฏีกีถ ีทึีปีกีถ ีธึ ีทึีพีฅึ ีพีกึีธึีคีถีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ, ีธึีธีถึ ีญีธีฝึีธีพี ีกึีคีฅีถ ีฟึีกีฏีกีถ ีชีกีดีกีถีกีฏ ีงี ีถีทีพีกีฎ ีฐีกีฟีพีกีฎีถีฅึีจ ีนีฅีถ ึีธีฝีกีฌึีพีธึีดึ ิตึึีกีถีซ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีฌึีกีฟีพีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีขีกีชีถีซึ ีฐีกีตีฟีถีธึีด ีฅีถี ีดีกึีฟีซ 27-ีซึ ีดีฅีฏีถีกึีฏีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ึีธีฝีกีถีธึีธีฃีดีกีถ ีกีทีญีกีฟีกีถึีถีฅึ, ึ ีขีธีฌีธึ ีกีตีถ ึีธีฒีธึีถีฅึีจ, ีธึีฟีฅีฒ ีฏีก ึีธีฝีกีถีธึีธีฃีดีกีถ ีฏีกึีซึ, ีถีฅึีกีผีพีกีฎ ีฅีถ ีฎึีกีฃึีซ ีดีฅีปึ

entry.title: Blinken warns Aliyev against increasing tensions with Armenia on eve of major summit

media:group.media:title: Blinken warns Aliyev against increasing tensions with Armenia on eve of major summit
media:group.media:description:
๐ The U.S. Secretary of State Anthony Blinken cautioned Azerbaijan that there is no justification for increased tension on the border ahead of a major Armenia-EU-U.S. summit. ๐ Russia again called on all sides to show restraint as tensions between Armenia and Azerbaijan continue to escalate. ๐ Armenia expects a Russian-led military alliance to confirm Azerbaijan is occupying parts of the country, a senior Armenian diplomat said. ๐ Israeli police officers and settlers clashed with Armenian activists in Jerusalemโs Armenian Quarter amid ongoing tensions over a contentious lease deal.

media:group.media:title: Armeniaโs Balancing Act In Brussels
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet host Patrick Elliot sits down with political commentator Eric Hacopian to talk about the upcoming Armenia-US-EU meeting in Brussels, as well as the Russian and Azerbaijani reactions. They also touch on the issue of the four border villages in Tavush, and finally, the recent string of terrorist actions in Armenia.

media:group.media:description:
2024 ีฉีพีกีฏีกีถีซ ีกีผีกีปีซีถ ีฅีผีกีดีฝีตีกีฏีธึีด ีฝีฟีพีฅึีกีตีซีถ ีทึีปีกีถีกีผีธึีฉีตีธึีถีซึ ีคีธึึีฝ ีง ีขีฅึีพีฅีฌ 52 ีดีฌึีค ีคึีกีด, ีธึีซึ 22 ีดีฌึีค ีคึีกีดีจ ีบีฅีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถีจ ีบีกีฟีณีกีผีพีกีฎ ีพีถีกีฝีถ ีง ีฅีฒีฅีฌโค ีกีตีถ ีพีฅึีกีฏีกีถีฃีถีพีฅีฌ ีง 13,3 ีดีฌึีค ีคึีกีดีซ ีนีกึีธีพ: ิฑีตีค ีดีกีฝีซีถ ยซีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉ ีขีซีฆีถีฅีฝีซยป ีฅีฉีฅึีธึีด ีกีฝีธึีด ีง ีี ีบีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฅีฏีกีดีธึีฟีถีฅึีซ ีฏีธีดีซีฟีฅีซ ีฐีฅีฟีกึีถีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึ ึ ีบีฅึีกีฟีซีพ ีฐีฅีฟีกีญีธึีฆีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีพีกึีนีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีฅีฟ ีีกีฐีกีถ ีีกึีญีซึีกีฌีกีฏีตีกีถีจ: ีีก ีกีถีคึีกีคีกีผีถีธึีด ีง ีกีผึีกีถึ ีญีกีถีธึีฉีถีฅึีซ ึ ีขีฌีธีฃีฅึีถีฅึีซ ีกีทีญีกีฟีกีถึีซีถี ีถีทีฅีฌีธีพ, ีธึ ีฃีธึีฎีธึีถีฅีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีกีตีค ีฟีฅีฝีกีฏีจ ีนีซ ีฏีกึีธีฒ ีฝีฟีพีฅึีธึีด ีดีถีกีฌ ึ ีคึีก ีฐีกึีฏีดีกีถ ีธึีฒีฒีธึีฉีตีกีดีข ีกีทีญีกีฟีกีถึีถีฅึ ีฅีถ ีฟีกึีพีธึีด:
